COMMEMORATION EXERCISES TOMORROW
J. V. A. MacMurray to Make
Principal Address
54TH ANNIVERSARY
Dr. Goodnow to Receive Honorary Degree
John Van Antwerp MacMurray
will make the principal address at
the fifty-fourth Commemoration
Day Exercises which will be held
at 11 a. m. tomorrow morning at
the Peabody Institute. The subject
of Mr. MacMurray's address will
be, "An Approach to the Problem
of International Relationships."
Mr. and Mrs. MacMurray will be
the guests of honor at a luncheon
to be held at Gilman Hall following
the exercises.
Dr. Goodnow

THE JOHNS HOPKINS NEWS-LETTER, FEBRUARY 21, 1930

BARNSTORMERS ISSUE
CALL FOR CANDIDATES
Any person wishing to try
out for the 1930 production
of the Johns Hopkin's Barnstormer's Club should report
at the Barn at 2:30 o'clock
tomorrow afternoon, Saturday. The play, "If I were
King," has 27 speaking parts
and will need at least 25 extras. There is also to be a
ballet dance for which about
eight people will be needed. So
far not nearly enough men
have turned out and several
speaking parts are still open.
Any man who studies at the
University is eligible for a
part.

COSMOPOLITAN CLUB
TO SPONSOR DANCE
The Intercollegiate Cosmopolitan Club will hold its annual dance on Saturday night,
March 8, in the Great Hall of
Levering Hall. This dance will
be held in place of the regular
Saturday night dance sponsored by the Cotillion Board.
There will be a door prize
and a few added attractions.
The price of admission will be
the nominal sum of $1.00 per
couple or stag.
This affair will be an informal one and will last from 9
'til 1. Music will be furnished
by Joe Cromwell's Orchestra.

COMMEMORATION EXERCISES TOMORROW
J. V. A. MacMurray to Make
Principal Address
54TH ANNIVERSARY
Dr. Goodnow to Receive Honorary Degree
John Van Antwerp MacMurray
will make the principal address at
the fifty-fourth Commemoration
Day Exercises which will be held
at 11 a. m. tomorrow morning at
the Peabody Institute. The subject
of Mr. MacMurray's address will
be, "An Approach to the Problem
of International Relationships."
Mr. and Mrs. MacMurray will be
the guests of honor at a luncheon
to be held at Gilman Hall following
the exercises.
Dr. Goodnow

THE JOHNS HOPKINS NEWS-LETTER, FEBRUARY 21, 1930

BARNSTORMERS ISSUE
CALL FOR CANDIDATES
Any person wishing to try
out for the 1930 production
of the Johns Hopkin's Barnstormer's Club should report
at the Barn at 2:30 o'clock
tomorrow afternoon, Saturday. The play, "If I were
King," has 27 speaking parts
and will need at least 25 extras. There is also to be a
ballet dance for which about
eight people will be needed. So
far not nearly enough men
have turned out and several
speaking parts are still open.
Any man who studies at the
University is eligible for a
part.

COSMOPOLITAN CLUB
TO SPONSOR DANCE
The Intercollegiate Cosmopolitan Club will hold its annual dance on Saturday night,
March 8, in the Great Hall of
Levering Hall. This dance will
be held in place of the regular
Saturday night dance sponsored by the Cotillion Board.
There will be a door prize
and a few added attractions.
The price of admission will be
the nominal sum of $1.00 per
couple or stag.
This affair will be an informal one and will last from 9
'til 1. Music will be furnished
by Joe Cromwell's Orchestra.
